isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: ROCKWELL - ASSEMBLY - INSTALL DRIVE SHAFT AND STEERING KNUCKLE TO HOUSING

svcproc.title: INSTALL DRIVE SHAFT AND STEERING KNUCKLE TO HOUSING

step1.para: Install a new seal on the outer drive shaft.

If required, install a new inner drive shaft bushing, thrust washer and seal to the housing ( Figure 28). Use a correct size sleeve or driver. Apply a layer of non- hardening sealing compound to the seal retainers before the seals are installed. Refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION AND SEALERS in CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the correct sealer.

figure.caption: Figure 28. Inner Drive Shaft Bushing, Thrust Washer and Seal

caution.para: Do not force or hit the seal after it is correctly installed in its seat. The seal retainer can be damaged.

step1.para: If the socket plugs were removed from the housing, use the following procedures to install them:

step2.para: Full Bushing King Pin Design ( Figure 28 and Figure 29):

step3.para: Drive new bushings into the socket bores so that the bushings are level with the outside of the socket.

note.para: "Easy-Steer" bushings are not interchangeable with standard bushings on axles not designed for "Easy-Steer."

step3.para: Install new socket plugs into the inside socket bores so that the plugs are against the bushings. Carefully tackweld the plugs in the same positions as the first tack welds.

step2.para: Full Bearing King Pin Design ( Figure 29):

step3.para: Apply a layer of silicone gasket material to the mounting surfaces of the plugs ONLY. Refer to SILICONE GASKET MATERIAL.
Install the plugs flat against the journals of the inside socket bores with the closed side of the plugs toward the center of the axle.
Apply hand pressure to the plugs before the gasket material sets.
Clean any gasket material from the tops of the plugs and the inside of the bores.

step1.para: Install the bearing cups, in the socket bores of the housing. Use a correct size sleeve or driver and be sure that bearing cups are flat against the socket plugs.

note.para: On Full Bushing King Pin Design knuckles, install the thrust washer and lock pin on the lower socket bore.

step1.para: On Full Bearing King Pin Design knuckles, install the oil seals flat in their bores in the housing ( Figure 29).

note.para: On Full Bushing knuckles, the oil seals must be installed on the knuckle caps. (See Steps 9 and 10.)

step1.para: If removed, assemble the steering arm and ball stud to the upper knuckle cap.

Install the universal joint into the housing. Carefully align the inner shaft splines with the splines of the differential side gear. Inspect the housing seal and thrust washer to be sure that these pieces are correctly installed ( Figure 30).
Put the knuckle in its correct position over the end of the housing. Align the knuckle bores with the housing bores.
Assemble the lower knuckle cap assembly first ( Figures 29 and Figure 31).

step3.para: Install the oil seal against its journal on the lower cap.
Press the lower cap assembly through the bottom bores of the knuckle and housing until the cap is against the knuckle.
Install the capscrews and tighten to the correct torque. Refer to TORQUE CHART.
Install shims, if used, and the bearing cone against its journal on the lower cap.
Carefully press the lower cap assembly through the bottom bores of the knuckle and the housing until the cap is against the knuckle.
Install the capscrews and tighten to the correct torque. Refer to TORQUE CHART.

item.para: Axles made after 1990 DO NOT require shims at the lower knuckle cap.
If the old knuckles, caps and bearings are reinstalled, use the same amount of shim thickness as was removed during disassembly.

step1.para: Assemble the upper knuckle cap assembly ( Figures 29).

step2.para: Full Bushing King Pin Design Knuckles:

step3.para: Use the same thickness shim pack that was removed during disassembly. The shim pack must contain a minimum of three shims.
Install the shims and oil seal against the base of the upper cap.
Press the cap assembly through the upper bores of the knuckle and housing until the cap is against the knuckle.
Install the four capscrews and tighten to the correct torque. Refer to TORQUE CHART.

step2.para: Full Bearing King Pin Design Knuckles:

step3.para: Use the same thickness shim pack that was removed during disassembly. The shim pack must contain a minimum of three shims.
Install the shims and bearing cone on the upper cap.
Carefully press the cap assembly through the upper bores of the knuckle and housing until the cap is against the knuckle.
Install the four capscrews and tighten to the correct torque. Refer to TORQUE CHART.
